meanings.sent1: The crowded bus made people justles for a seat.
meanings.sent2: The players justles for the ball during the game.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully justles each other for the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The waves justles against the rocks, trying to reach the shore.
meanings.sent5: The students justles to be the first in line for lunch.

meanings.definition: To compete for space or position.
meanings.sent1: The cars justles for a parking spot in the busy lot.
meanings.sent2: The animals justles for a spot under the shade tree.
meanings.sent3: The kids justles to be in the front row for the school play.
meanings.sent4: The clouds justles in the sky, trying to cover the sun.
meanings.sent5: The shoppers justles to grab the last item on sale.

meanings.definition: To struggle or fight for dominance.
meanings.sent1: The lions justles for control of the pride.
meanings.sent2: The candidates justles for the lead in the election polls.
meanings.sent3: The siblings justles for the remote to choose a TV show.
meanings.sent4: The wind justles with the trees, trying to show its strength.
meanings.sent5: The teams justles for the championship title in the final match.
